title: Bug 120922: "Dirty Page" behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs to be improved
description: When editing XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then trying to switch back to the Layout view, an error message appears indicating that the changes need to be saved. The problem is that the user is left unsure about how to save the changes or discard them, which makes it difficult to proceed. The error message is also not very clear as it is simply "Source page is dirty". Additionally, the confirmation dialog that appears when trying to switch views is titled "Error".
OB: If you edit the XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and then try to switch back to the Layout view, you will get an error message indicating that you need to save your changes. The error message is not clear and does not provide instructions for saving or discarding the changes.
EB: When editing XML in the "source" view of the Layout Editor and trying to switch back to the Layout view, a clear and informative error message should be displayed that guides the user on how to save or discard the changes. The confirmation dialog should also have a more appropriate title that reflects its purpose.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Switch to the "source" view.
3. Make some changes to the XML.
4. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
5. Observe the error message displayed.
6. Try to save the changes and see if it works.
7. Try to discard the changes and see if it works.
8. Cancel the action and check if you remain on the Source page.
